case_title: M/s. Muhammad Yousuf Adil vs Deputy Commissioner SRB, Karachi

facts.act: Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011
facts.allegation: Appellant provided taxable services since July 2015 but failed to register with SRB.

order_in_original.penalty: Rs. 100,000 if not voluntarily registered by 2016-06-15

appellant.representative: Mr. Muhammad Tariq and Mr. Muhammad Mudassir ITP
appellant.argument: Mere renting of immovable property does not constitute a taxable service under the Sindh Sales Tax on Services Act, 2011, as per High Court of Sindh judgment in CP No.D-2421/2016.

respondent.argument: Department will comply with the High Court order but may challenge it in the future.

key_judgment_points.precedent_case: Youngs (Private Limited) vs Province of Sindh
key_findings: Renting of immovable property does not involve provision of taxable services.
Economic activity must involve provision of services to be taxable under the Act.
Provincial legislature cannot impose tax on rent received by landlords.
